data.title: The Man Without Qualities - 3 Volume Set
data.meta_description: London: Secker & Warburg, 1953-1960. First Editions. Hardcover. First Editions of the first English translation of Musil’s unfinished masterpiece Der Mann Ohne Eigenschaften, first published in German in 1930. Translated from the German and with a foreword by Eithne Wilkins & Ernst Kaiser.A philosophical and satirical novel focusing on a year in the life of an Austrian
data.text:
London: Secker & Warburg, 1953-1960.

First Editions. Hardcover.

First Editions of the first English translation of Musil’s unfinished masterpiece Der Mann Ohne Eigenschaften, first published in German in 1930. Translated from the German and with a foreword by Eithne Wilkins & Ernst Kaiser.

A philosophical and satirical novel focusing on a year in the life of an Austrian intellectual before the onset of World War I, The Man Without Qualities is widely considered to be one of the greatest German novels of the first half of the 20th century.

Volume 1, Book 1: A Sort of Introduction; Book 2: The Like of It Now Happens (I), 1953.

Volume II, Book 2 (continued): The Like of It Now Happens (II), 1954.

Volume III, Book 3: Into the Millennium (The Criminals), 1960.

Musil worked on a fourth and final volume until his death in 1942. Although a fourth volume including drafts of the final unfinished chapters and Musil’s notes on the development of the novel was published in 1943, these first three volumes represent the complete work published in Musil’s lifetime and with Musil’s participation.

Item #901757

5-3/4 x 8-3/4”, green cloth with red and gilt titles, foreword, xxxv, 365pp, vii, 453pp, xi, 445pp.

Owner’s bookplate first paste-down endpaper Volumes I & III, owner’s bookplate removed first paste-down endpaper Volume II with related loss of paper surface, mild bumping to a few corners, shallow dog-ears to upper corners of several leaves, clean, tight, square, a very good set in well-preserved price-intact spine darkened dust wrappers with a bit of soiling and mild edge-wear (including a ½ x 1” chip to flap-fold of the dust wrapper of Volume I), in protective mylars.
